episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of quirky and historical facts, including the use of pig fat in early ice skating rinks, a fly-swatting competition in Toronto, the innovative animation techniques used in Disney's "101 Dalmatians," and the discovery that seeds have a brain-like decision-making process.

facts.fact: Early ice skating rinks stank of pig fat.
In 1912, the Toronto government ran a fly swatting competition, which was won by a 15-year-old girl who killed half a million flies.
When animating 101 Dalmatians, Disney photocopied the dogs.
